src/set_metrics.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********+*********+*********+*********+*********+*********+*********+*
00002  *                                                                    *
00003  *  By Robert Hallberg, November 1998                                 *
00004  *                                                                    *
00005  *    This program contains 1 subroutine.  set_metrics calculates     *
00006  *  the various metric terms that are used by HIM.  This routine is   *
00007  *  intended to be modified by the user to enable the use of any      *
00008  *  general orthogonal grid.                                          *
00009  *                                                                    *
00010  *    This subroutine is also used by HIMtocdf.                       *
00011  *                                                                    *
00012  *    The metric terms have the form dzp, Idzp, or dxDYp, where z can *
00013  *  be x or y, and p can be q, u, v, or h.  z describes the direction *
00014  *  of the metric, while p describes the location.  ILzp is the       *
00015  *  inverse of Lzp, while dxdyp is the produce of dxp and dyp.        *
00016  *                                                                    *
00017  *    Variables written all in capital letters are defined in init.h. *
00018  *                                                                    *
00019  *     A small fragment of the C-grid is shown below:                 *
00020  *                                                                    *
00021  *    j+1  x ^ x ^ x   At x:  q, dxq, Idxq, dyq, Idyq, etc.           *
00022  *    j+1  > o > o >   At ^:  v, dxv, Idxv, dyv, Idyv, etc.           *
00023  *    j    x ^ x ^ x   At >:  u, dxu, Idxu, dyu, Idyu, etc.           *
00024  *    j    > o > o >   At o:  h, dxh, Idxh, dyh, Idyh, dxdyh, etc.    *
00025  *    j-1  x ^ x ^ x                                                  *
00026  *        i-1  i  i+1  At x & ^:                                      *
00027  *           i  i+1    At > & o:                                      *
00028  *                                                                    *
00029  *  The boundaries always run through q grid points (x).              *
00030  *                                                                    *
00031  ********+*********+*********+*********+*********+*********+*********+*/
00032 
00033 #include <stdio.h>
00034 #include <stdlib.h>
00035 #include <math.h>
00036 #include "init.h"
00037 #include "metrics.h"
00038 
00039 double latq[NYMEM];                  /* The latitude of q points.     */
00040 double lath[NYMEM];                  /* The latitude of h points.     */
00041 double lonq[NXMEM];                  /* The longitude of q points.    */
00042 double lonh[NXMEM];                  /* The longitude of h points.    */
00043 #if defined(PARALLEL_Y) && !defined(PARALLEL_IO) && defined(NETCDF_OUTPUT)
00044 double lath_tot[NYTOT+Y1];           /* The latitude of all points in */
00045 double latq_tot[NYTOT+Y1];           /* the whole domain.             */
00046 #endif
00047 #if defined(PARALLEL_X) && !defined(PARALLEL_IO) && defined(NETCDF_OUTPUT)
00048 double lonh_tot[NXTOT+X1];           /* The longitude of all points   */
00049 double lonq_tot[NXTOT+X1];           /* in the whole domain.          */
00050 #endif
00051 #if defined(PARALLEL_X) || defined(PARALLEL_Y)
00052 extern int pe_here;                  /* The current processor's label.*/
00053 #else
00054 #define pe_here 0                    /* Without running in parallel,  */
00055                                      /* the current processor is 0.   */
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 #ifdef PARALLEL_X
00059 extern int nx;                       /* The number of x-points in the */
00060                                      /* physical domain calculated by */
00061                                      /* the current processor.        */
00062 extern int X0abs;                    /* The absolute index of X0 on   */
00063                                      /* the current processor, rel-   */
00064                                      /* ative to X0 on processor 0.   */
00065 #else
00066 #define X0abs 0                      /* X0abs on processor 0 is 0.    */
00067 #endif
00068 #ifdef PARALLEL_Y
00069 extern int ny;                       /* The number of y-points in the */
00070                                      /* physical domain calculated by */
00071                                      /* the current processor.        */
00072 int Y0abs;                           /* The absolute index of Y0 on   */
00073                                      /* the current processor, rel-   */
00074                                      /* ative to Y0 on processor 0.   */
00075 #else
00076 #define Y0abs 0                      /* Y0abs on processor 0 is 0.    */
00077 #endif
00078 
00079 #ifdef ISOTROPIC
00080 double find_root(double fnval,double y,int *ittmax);
00081 #define INTSECY(y) (((y) >= 0.0) ? (log((1.0 + sin(y))/cos(y))) : (-log((1.0 - sin(y))/cos(y))))
00082 #endif
00083 
00084 extern double qlat[NYMEM],hlat[NYMEM];
00085 
00086 void set_metrics(void)
00087 {
00088   int i,j;
00089   extern double areagr[NXMEM][NYMEM];
00090   double Iareagr[NXMEM][NYMEM];
00091   extern double D[NXMEM][NYMEM];
00092 
00093 /*    Calculate the values of the metric terms that might be used     */
00094 /*  and save them in arrays.                                          */
00095 
00096 #ifdef CARTESIAN
00097 /*   On a cartesian grid, the various DX... and DY... macros all      */
00098 /* point to the same scalars.                                         */
00099   i = 0; j = 0;
00100   DXh(i,j) = RE * LENLON * M_PI / (180.0 * NXTOT);
00101   DYh(i,j) = RE * LENLAT * M_PI / (180.0 * NYTOT);
00102   IDXh(i,j) = 1.0 / DXh(i,j);
00103   IDYh(i,j) = 1.0 / DYh(i,j);
00104   DXDYh(i,j) = DXh(i,j) * DYh(i,j);
00105   IDXDYh(i,j) = IDXh(i,j) * IDYh(i,j);
00106   for (j=Y0-1;j<=ny+2;j++)
00107     latq[j] = LOWLAT + LENLAT*(double)(j-Y0+Y0abs)/(double)NYTOT;
00108   for (j=Y0;j<=ny;j++)
00109     lath[j] = LOWLAT + LENLAT*((double)(j-Y0+Y0abs)-0.5)/(double)NYTOT;
00110   for (i=X0-1;i<=nx+2;i++)
00111     lonq[i] = WESTLON + LENLON*(double)(i-X0+X0abs)/(double)NXTOT;
00112   for (i=X0;i<=nx;i++)
00113     lonh[i] = WESTLON + LENLON*((double)(i-X0+X0abs)-0.5)/(double)NXTOT;
00114 # if defined(PARALLEL_Y) && !defined(PARALLEL_IO) && defined(NETCDF_OUTPUT)
00115   for (j=Y0;j<=NYTOT+Y0;j++)
00116     latq_tot[j] = LOWLAT + LENLAT*(double)(j-Y0)/(double)NYTOT;
00117   for (j=Y0;j<=NYTOT+Y0;j++)
00118     lath_tot[j] = LOWLAT + LENLAT*((double)(j-Y0)-0.5)/(double)NYTOT;
00119 # endif
00120 # if defined(PARALLEL_X) && !defined(PARALLEL_IO) && defined(NETCDF_OUTPUT)
00121   for (i=X0;i<=NXTOT+X0;i++)
00122     lonq_tot[i] = WESTLON + LENLON*(double)(i-X0)/(double)NXTOT;
00123   for (i=X0;i<=NXTOT+X0;i++)
00124     lonh_tot[i] = WESTLON + LENLON*((double)(i-X0)-0.5)/(double)NXTOT;
00125 # endif
00126 #else
00127 
00128 /*   All of the metric terms should be defined over the domain from   */
00129 /* X0-1 to nx+2.  Outside of the physical domain, both the metrics    */
00130 /* and their inverses may be set to zero.                             */
00131 /*   Any points that are outside of the computational domain should   */
00132 /* have their values set to zero _BEFORE_ setting the other metric    */
00133 /* terms, because these macros may or may not expand to 2-dimensional */
00134 /* arrays.                                                            */
00135 
00136 /*  The metric terms within the computational domain are set here.    */
00137 
00138 # ifdef ISOTROPIC
00139 
00140   {
00141     double C0, I_C0, yq, yh, jd;
00142     double fnRef, yRef; /* fnRef is the value of the integral of      */
00143                         /* 1/(dx*cos(lat)) from the equator to a      */
00144                         /* reference latitude, while yRef is the      */
00145                         /* j-index of that reference latitude.        */
00146     int itt1, itt2;
00147 
00148     C0 = M_PI*((double) LENLON / (double) (180*NXTOT)); I_C0 = 1.0 / C0;
00149 
00150 /*    With an isotropic grid, the north-south extent of the domain,   */
00151 /*  the east-west extent, and the number of grid points in each       */
00152 /*  direction are _not_ independent.  Here the north-south extent     */
00153 /*  will be determined to fit the east-west extent and the number of  */
00154 /*  grid points.  The grid is perfectly isotropic.                    */
00155 #  ifdef NORTHREFERENCE
00156 /*  The following 2 lines fixes the refererence latitude at the       */
00157 /*  northern edge of the domain, LOWLAT+LENLAT at j=NYTOT+Y0.         */
00158     yRef = Y0abs - Y0 - NYTOT;
00159     fnRef = I_C0 * INTSECY(((LOWLAT+LENLAT)*M_PI/180.0));
00160 #  else
00161 /*  The following line sets the refererence latitude LOWLAT at j=Y0.  */
00162     yRef = Y0abs - Y0;   fnRef = I_C0 * INTSECY((LOWLAT*M_PI/180.0));
00163 #  endif
00164 
00165 /*  Everything else should pretty much work.                          */
00166     yq = LOWLAT*M_PI/180.0;
00167 /* If the model is in parallel in the Y-direction, do the same set of */
00168 /* calculations which would occur on a single processor.              */
00169     for (j=Y0-1-Y0abs;j<Y0-1;j++) {
00170       jd = fnRef + (double) (j + yRef) - 0.5;
00171       yh = find_root(jd,yq,&itt1);
00172 
00173       jd = fnRef + (double) (j + yRef);
00174       yq = find_root(jd,yh,&itt2);
00175 #  if defined(PARALLEL_Y) && !defined(PARALLEL_IO) && defined(NETCDF_OUTPUT)
00176       latq_tot[j+Y0abs] = yq*180.0/M_PI;
00177       lath_tot[j+Y0abs] = yh*180.0/M_PI;
00178 #  endif
00179     }
00180     
00181     for (j=Y0-1;j<=ny+2;j++) {
00182       jd = fnRef + (double) (j + yRef) - 0.5;
00183       yh = find_root(jd,yq,&itt1);
00184 
00185       jd = fnRef + (double) (j + yRef);
00186       yq = find_root(jd,yh,&itt2);
00187 
00188       latq[j] = yq*180.0/M_PI;
00189       lath[j] = yh*180.0/M_PI;
00190 #  if defined(PARALLEL_Y) && !defined(PARALLEL_IO) && defined(NETCDF_OUTPUT)
00191       latq_tot[j+Y0abs] = yq*180.0/M_PI;
00192       lath_tot[j+Y0abs] = yh*180.0/M_PI;
00193 #  endif
00194 
00195       for (i=X0-1;i<=nx+2;i++) {
00196         DXq(i,j) = cos(yq) * (RE * C0);
00197         DYq(i,j) = DXq(i,j);
00198 
00199         DXv(i,j) = DXq(i,j);
00200         DYv(i,j) = DYq(i,j);
00201 
00202         DXh(i,j) = cos(yh) * (RE * C0);
00203         DYh(i,j) = DXh(i,j);
00204 
00205         DXu(i,j) = DXh(i,j);
00206         DYu(i,j) = DYh(i,j);
00207       }
00208     }
00209 #  if defined(PARALLEL_Y) && !defined(PARALLEL_IO) && defined(NETCDF_OUTPUT)
00210     for (j=ny+3;j<=NYTOT+Y0-Y0abs;j++) {
00211       jd = fnRef + (double) (j + yRef) - 0.5;
00212       yh = find_root(jd,yq,&itt1);
00213 
00214       jd = fnRef + (double) (j + yRef);
00215       yq = find_root(jd,yh,&itt2);
00216       latq_tot[j+Y0abs] = yq*180.0/M_PI;
00217       lath_tot[j+Y0abs] = yh*180.0/M_PI;
00218     }
00219 #  endif
00220   }
00221   for (i=X0-1;i<=nx+2;i++)
00222     lonq[i] = WESTLON + LENLON*(double)(i-X0+X0abs)/(double)NXTOT;
00223   for (i=X0;i<=nx;i++)
00224     lonh[i] = WESTLON + LENLON*((double)(i-X0+X0abs)-0.5)/(double)NXTOT;
00225 #  if defined(PARALLEL_X) && !defined(PARALLEL_IO) && defined(NETCDF_OUTPUT)
00226   for (i=X0;i<=NXTOT+X0;i++)
00227     lonq_tot[i] = WESTLON + LENLON*(double)(i-X0)/(double)NXTOT;
00228   for (i=X0;i<=NXTOT+X0;i++)
00229     lonh_tot[i] = WESTLON + LENLON*((double)(i-X0)-0.5)/(double)NXTOT;
00230 #  endif
00231 
00232 # else         /*  ISOTROPIC  */
00233 
00234 /* This code implements latitude/longitude coordinates on a sphere.   */
00235 
00236 //BX-a
00237 //    for (j=0;j<=NYTOT-1;j++) {
00238 //HF    for (j=Y0-1;j<=ny+2;j++) {
00239    for (j=2;j<NYTOT+2;j++) {
00240         latq[j] = qlat[j];
00241         lath[j] = hlat[j];
00242     }
00243 //BX-e
00244 /* HF  for (i=0;i<=NXTOT-1;i++) {
00245     for (j=0;j<=NYTOT-1;j++) {
00246         DXq(i+2,j+2) = dxq[j][i];
00247         DYq(i+2,j+2) = dyq[j][i];
00248         DXv(i+2,j+2) = dxv[j][i];
00249         DYv(i+2,j+2) = dyv[j][i];
00250         DXh(i+2,j+2) = dxh[j][i];
00251         DYh(i+2,j+2) = dyh[j][i];
00252         DXu(i+2,j+2) = dxu[j][i];
00253         DYu(i+2,j+2) = dyu[j][i];
00254     }
00255     } */
00256 
00257 //BX-a
00258   for (i=X0-1;i<=nx+2;i++)
00259     lonq[i] = WESTLON + LENLON*(double)(i-X0+X0abs)/(double)NXTOT;
00260 
00261   for (i=X0;i<=nx;i++)
00262     lonh[i] = WESTLON + LENLON*((double)(i-X0+X0abs)-0.5)/(double)NXTOT;
00263 //BX-e
00264 #endif
00265 
00266 
00267 /* The remaining code should not be changed.                         */
00268   for (i=X0-1;i<=nx+2;i++) {
00269     for (j=Y0-1;j<=ny+2;j++) {
00270       IDXh(i,j) = (DXh(i,j) > 0.0) ? (1.0 / DXh(i,j)) : 0.0;
00271       IDXu(i,j) = (DXu(i,j) > 0.0) ? (1.0 / DXu(i,j)) : 0.0;
00272       IDXv(i,j) = (DXv(i,j) > 0.0) ? (1.0 / DXv(i,j)) : 0.0;
00273       IDXq(i,j) = (DXq(i,j) > 0.0) ? (1.0 / DXq(i,j)) : 0.0;
00274       IDYh(i,j) = (DYh(i,j) > 0.0) ? (1.0 / DYh(i,j)) : 0.0;
00275       IDYu(i,j) = (DYu(i,j) > 0.0) ? (1.0 / DYu(i,j)) : 0.0;
00276       IDYv(i,j) = (DYv(i,j) > 0.0) ? (1.0 / DYv(i,j)) : 0.0;
00277       IDYq(i,j) = (DYq(i,j) > 0.0) ? (1.0 / DYq(i,j)) : 0.0;
00278 
00279       //HF alternate def: DXDYh(i,j) = DXh(i,j) * DYh(i,j);
00280       //HF alternate def: IDXDYh(i,j) = IDXh(i,j) * IDYh(i,j);
00281       DXDYq(i,j) = DXq(i,j) * DYq(i,j);
00282       IDXDYq(i,j) = IDXq(i,j) * IDYq(i,j);
00283 
00284       Iareagr[i][j] = (areagr[i][j] > 0.0) ? (1.0 / areagr[i][j]) : 0.0;
00285       DXDYh(i,j) = areagr[i][j];
00286       IDXDYh(i,j) = Iareagr[i][j];
00287     }
00288   }
00289 
00290 #endif /* CARTESIAN */
00291 }
00292 
00293 
00294 #ifdef ISOTROPIC
00295 double find_root(double fnval,double y,int *ittmax)
00296 {
00297   double ybot, ytop, fnbot, fntop, fny, dy_dfn, dy;
00298   double C0, I_C0;
00299   int itt;
00300 
00301   C0 = M_PI*((double) LENLON / (double) (180*NXTOT)); I_C0 = 1.0 / C0;
00302 /*  Bracket the root. */
00303   ybot = y;
00304   fnbot = I_C0 * INTSECY(ybot) - fnval;
00305   while (fnbot > 0.0) {
00306     ybot = ((ybot - 2.0*C0*cos(ybot)) < (0.5*ybot-0.25*M_PI)) ? 
00307             (ybot - 2.0*C0*cos(ybot)) : (0.5*ybot-0.25*M_PI);
00308     fnbot = I_C0 * INTSECY(ybot) - fnval;
00309   }
00310   ytop = ((y + 2.0*C0*cos(y)) < (0.5*y+0.25*M_PI)) ? 
00311           (y + 2.0*C0*cos(y)) : (0.5*y+0.25*M_PI);
00312   fntop = I_C0 * INTSECY(ytop) - fnval;
00313   while (fntop < 0.0) {
00314     ytop = ((ytop + 2.0*C0*cos(ytop)) < (0.5*ytop+0.25*M_PI)) ? 
00315             (ytop + 2.0*C0*cos(ytop)) : (0.5*ytop+0.25*M_PI);
00316     fntop = I_C0 * INTSECY(ytop) - fnval;
00317   }
00318 /*  Bisect several times to insure that the root is within the radius */
00319 /*  of convergence in the Newton's method polisher.                   */
00320   for (itt=0;itt<10;itt++) {
00321     y = 0.5*(ybot + ytop);
00322     fny = I_C0 * INTSECY(y) - fnval;
00323     if (fny < 0.0) { fnbot = fny; ybot = y; }
00324     else { fntop = fny; ytop = y; }
00325   }
00326 
00327 /*    Polish the root using Newton's method.                          */
00328   for (itt=0;itt<10;itt++) {
00329     dy_dfn = C0 * cos(y);
00330     fny = I_C0 * INTSECY(y) - fnval;
00331 
00332     dy = - fny * dy_dfn; y += dy;
00333     if (y > ytop) y = ytop; if (y < ybot) y = ybot;
00334     if (fabs(dy) < (8.0e-15*fabs(y)+1.e-20)) break;
00335   }
00336   if (fabs(y) < 1e-12) y = 0.0;
00337 
00338    *ittmax = itt;
00339    return(y);
00340 }
00341 #endif
